header.abstract: The Young Historians Club/Alumni Association Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School (dated 1919-2021; 35.41 cubic feet and 340 Megabytes; 42 boxes, 2 slim document boxes, 29 wrapped items, 2 flat boxes, 1 paper box, and 7 digital files) comprises yearbooks, newspapers and other publications, minutes, reports, scrapbooks, clippings, and corespondence documenting the administration, curriculum, student activities, and alumni of Henry Clay High School in Lexington, Kentucky.

descriptive_summary.author: Archives staff, Deana Thomas, Ruth E. Bryan
descriptive_summary.title: Young Historians Club/Alumni Association Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School
descriptive_summary.source: Young Historians Club/Alumni Association Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2009ms048: [identification of item], Young Historians Club/Alumni Association Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School, 1919-2021, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1904, Morton High School, the first four-year high school for white students in Lexington, Kentucky, was opened with 192 students attending in the old Morton School building on the corner of Short Street and Walnut Street. A new building replaced that one in 1908. In 1918, that building became Morton Junior High School, the high school was renamed Lexington High School, and moved to another new building on the corner of Fourth Street and Limestone Street. In 1928, that building became Lexington Junior High School, the high school moved into a new building on East Main Street, and was renamed Henry Clay High School because of the school's proximity to Ashland, Henry Clay's home. The high school moved to its current location at 2100 Fontaine Road in 1970, by which time the city schools had been merged with the Fayette County Schools. Currently, over 2000 students are enrolled.

Faculty member Ellen Claire Allen organized the Young Historians Club in 1969, prior to move from old to new high school in 1970. The majority of this collection was acquired by the Club or by the Alumni Association Archives Committee, with which Allen is involved.

Source: 2009ms048: Allen, Ellen Claire. Henry Clay High School--the History. Young Historians Club/Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School, 1919-2021, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Young Historians Club/Alumni Association Archives Committee collection on Henry Clay High School (dated 1919-2021; 35.41 cubic feet and 340 Megabytes; 42 boxes, 2 slim document boxes, 29 wrapped items, 2 flat boxes, 1 paper box, and 7 digital files) comprises yearbooks, newspapers and other publications, minutes, reports, scrapbooks, clippings, and corespondence documenting the administration, curriculum, student activities, and alumni of Henry Clay High School in Lexington, Kentucky.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Items wrapped in brown paper are numbered Bx. Items wrapped in white paper are numbered Wx. This is a preliminary collection guide. Items are physically stored in the order they were received. Items are listed arranged by subject or format. Box numbers are not consecutive.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises primarily newspaper clippings, 2011-2014. Also includes a few clippings, 1947-1978; school directories, 1946-1950; two trophies (Kentucky high school basketball tournament champions, 1919 and 1922); blue felt tip pen, "1983 state basketball champions;" yellow t-shirt square with Henry Clay Blue Devils logo and name; program for "The King and I," 1995; handwritten "criteria for a good teacher," written on back of a mimeographed note to Senior Home Rooms; and correspondence about the Henry Clay Archives. (1.7 cubic feet: 1 slim document box; 1 paper box)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises correspondence and memorabilia regarding the Henry Clay High School centennial, 2004-2005; notes by Ken Alexander on the Henry Clay High School class of 1922, along with correspondence between Alexander and Ellen Allen, 2006-2013; the 2014 Henry Clay High School yearbook, "Cirque du so Clay;" a 1950 graduate announcement card; and a dark blue stadium seat cushion printed with "HCHS" in gold letters and images of the school's mascot, the blue devils. (1 slim document box and 1 wrapped item)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises materials gathered by Ellen Allen, including a Henry Clay Key Club scrapbook (1969-1970); Bill Ambrose photographs, attendance badge, and conference program from attendance at the 1975 Key Club International Convention in New Orleans, La. (1975 June 29-July 2); Statesman yearbooks, 2019, 2020, 2021; "Murmurings" literary magazine (spring 1979, spring 1984); alumni information for Clay Lancaster, Dennis Perkinson ('64), and Ruth M. Matthews (dated 1964-1986); information about teacher Iva Dagley; and a historical sketch of the high school written by Ellen Claire Allen.
